Class ModernDigitalDate

java.lang.Object
net.xmercerweiss.mdc.ModernDigitalDate
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<ChronoLocalDate>, ChronoLocalDate, Temporal, TemporalAccessor, TemporalAdjuster
public class ModernDigitalDate extends Object implements ChronoLocalDate, Serializable
Represents a specific date within the Modern Digital Calendar system

Note that attempting to work with time-based values using this class is an error; see ModernDigitalChronology
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

    Formats this date using the pattern of the given formatter

    Note that calling formatter.format(date) will typically result in an error, as this method does not actually utilize the given formatter, rather it simply extracts its pattern and produces its output using its own implementation

  • Method Details

    • of

      public static ModernDigitalDate of(Era era, int yearOfEra, int monthOfYear, int dayOfMonth)
      Creates a new ModernDigitalDate instance representing the specified date
      Parameters:
      era - A ModernDigitalEra, not null
      yearOfEra - The year of the era, must be >= 0
      monthOfYear - The month of the year, 0 for leap days
      dayOfMonth - The day of the month, within [1, 28]
      Returns:
      A new ModernDigitalDate
      Throws:
      DateTimeException - If given an invalid date

    • of

      public static ModernDigitalDate of(int prolepticYear, int monthOfYear, int dayOfMonth)
      Creates a new ModernDigitalDate instance representing the specified date
      Parameters:
      prolepticYear - The number of years before (<0) or since (>= 0) 1970 ISO
      monthOfYear - The month of the year, 0 for leap days
      dayOfMonth - The day of the month, within [1, 28]
      Returns:
      A new ModernDigitalDate
      Throws:
      DateTimeException - If given an invalid date

    • ofYearDay

      public static ModernDigitalDate ofYearDay(int prolepticYear, int dayOfYear)
      Creates a new ModernDigitalDate instance representing the given ordinal (1st, 2nd, 3rd...) day of the specified proleptic year
      Parameters:
      prolepticYear - The number of years before (<0) or since (>= 0) 1970 ISO
      dayOfYear - The ordinal day of the year
      Returns:
      A new ModernDigitalDate
      Throws:
      DateTimeException - If given an invalid date

      Parameters:
      epochDay - The number of days before (<0) or since (>= 0) 1970-01-01 ISO
      Returns:

    • toEpochDay

      public long toEpochDay()
      Obtains the difference, in days, between this Date and 1970-01-01 ISO
      Specified by:
      toEpochDay in interface ChronoLocalDate
      Returns:
      A signed 64-bit integer, < 0 if this date comes before the epoch, > 0 if this date comes after the epoch, and 0 if this date is the epoch

    • lengthOfMonth

      public int lengthOfMonth()
      Obtains the number of days of the month this Date falls within. Given the nature of the Modern Digital Calendar, this value will always be either 28 or the number of leap days within the year of this date
      Specified by:
      lengthOfMonth in interface ChronoLocalDate
      Returns:
      A signed 32-bit integer, always either 28 or the number of leap days in the year of this date

    • lengthOfYear

      public int lengthOfYear()
      Obtains the number of days in the year of this date
      Specified by:
      lengthOfYear in interface ChronoLocalDate
      Returns:
      A signed 32-bit integer; always either 365 or 366

    • plus

      public ChronoLocalDate plus(long value, TemporalUnit unit)
      NOTE: This method may return inconsistent results. Notes discussing this can be found at docs/MISC.md#ChronoPeriods

      Returns a new ModernDigitalDate instance representing this Date plus a given number of a given TemporalUnit
      Specified by:
      plus in interface ChronoLocalDate
      Specified by:
      plus in interface Temporal
      Parameters:
      value - A signed 64-bit (truncated to 32-bit) integer number of units
      unit - Any ChronoUnit greater than or equal to DAYS, except FOREVER; not null
      Returns:
      A new ModernDigitalDate instance
      Throws:
      UnsupportedTemporalTypeException - If given a null or invalid unit

      NOTE: This method may return inconsistent results. Notes discussing this can be found at docs/MISC.md#ChronoPeriods

      Equivalent to... 
      ModernDigitalChronology.periodToUnit(
  thisDate.until(temporal),
  unit
);
      Specified by:
      until in interface ChronoLocalDate
      Specified by:
      until in interface Temporal
      Parameters:

    • until

      public ChronoPeriod until(ChronoLocalDate date)
      NOTE: This method may return inconsistent results. Notes discussing this can be found at docs/MISC.md#ChronoPeriods

      Calculates the difference between this Date and the given ChronoLocalDate as a ChronoPeriod. Will be negative if the given date is before this Date

      until in interface ChronoLocalDate
      Parameters:
      date - A valid ChronoLocalDate, not null
      Returns:
      A new ChronoPeriod
      Throws:

      public String format(DateTimeFormatter formatter)

      public boolean isLeapDay()
      Returns:
      true if this date is a leap day

      public int getYearOfEra()
      Gets the year of the era of this Date
      Returns:
      A signed 32-bit integer within [0, infinity)

    • getYear

      public int getYear()
      Gets the proleptic year of this Date
      Returns:
      A signed 32-bit integer

    • getMonth

      public int getMonth()
      Gets the month of this Date
      Returns:
      A signed 32-bit integer within [0, 13], 0 for leap days

    • getWeekOfYear

      public int getWeekOfYear()
      Gets the ordinal (1st, 2nd, 3rd...) week of the year of this Date
      Returns:
      A signed 32-bit integer within [0, 52], 0 for leap days

    • getDayOfYear

      public int getDayOfYear()
      Gets the ordinal (1st, 2nd, 3rd...) day of the year of this Date
      Returns:
      A signed 32-bit integer within [1, 366]

    • getDayOfMonth

      public int getDayOfMonth()
      Gets the day of the month of this Date
      Returns:
      A signed 32-bit integer within [1, 28]

    • getDayOfWeek

      public int getDayOfWeek()
      Gets the numeric value for the day of the week of this Date

      Following the conventions of ISO 8601, Monday has a value of 1 and Sunday has a value of 7 Leap days belong to no week and therefore have a value of 0
      Returns:
      A signed 32-bit integer within [0, 7]

    • getQuarter

      public int getQuarter()
      Gets the numeric value for the quarter of the year of this Date
      Returns:
      A signed 32-bit integer within [0, 4], 0 for leap days, which belong to no quarter

      public String format(String pattern)
      Formats this date using the given pattern
      Parameters:
      pattern - A formatting pattern as defined by DateTimeFormatter
      Returns:
      A String representation of this date matching the given pattern
